meanings.definition: Make (a person or animal) immune to infection, typically by inoculation.
meanings.sent1: The doctor immunises children against diseases with vaccines.
meanings.sent2: Getting a flu shot helps immunises your body against the flu virus.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special suit immunises him from harm.
meanings.sent4: Education immunises the mind against ignorance like a shield.
meanings.sent5: Think of vaccines as tiny warriors that immunise your body against invaders.

meanings.definition: Make (a person or animal) immune to a particular disease.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise and a healthy diet can help immunise you against heart disease.
meanings.sent2: The vaccine will immunise the population against the new strain of the virus.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a lucky charm is believed to immunise you from bad luck.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a shield to immunise her from negativity.
meanings.sent5: The ancient potion was said to immunise the villagers from the curse.
